body:
Comment 1: 
& ^ (note the space) is not equivalent to &^ (the former contains two tokens
while the latter is one token).

in fact, their semantics is not the same too; you can know the difference
if you change type of x to uint; the line "x = x & ^2" will trigger an error,
while the other line won't. (that is, &^ is not redundant.)

http://play.golang.org/p/mm-wqxpM7E
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
